cox5529.storage

Class Song

  • java.lang.Object
    • cox5529.storage.Song

  • public class Song
extends java.lang.Object
    Class to store songs.
    Author:
    Brandon Cox

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static int DEFAULT_MIDI_RESOLUTION
      The default resolution of all MIDI files (24).

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Song()
      Creates a song.

    • Method Detail

      • setInstrument

        public void setInstrument(ProgramChange.MidiProgram intstrument)
        Sets the instrument of the given Track object.
        Parameters:
        intstrument - The instrument number to change the track to.

      • setTempo

        public void setTempo(float tempo)
        Sets the tempo based on a give BPM count.
        Parameters:
        tempo - The BPM to set the tempo to.

      • setTimeSignature

        public void setTimeSignature()
        Sets the time signature to 4/4 time at the beginning of the song.

      • setTimeSignature

        public void setTimeSignature(int num,
                             int den)
        Sets the time signature to num/den time at the beginning of the song.
        Parameters:
        num - The numerator of the time signature.
        den - The denominator of the time signature.

      • playNote

        public void playNote(int channel,
                     int pitch,
                     int vel,
                     long tick,
                     long dur)
        Adds a note to the song.
        Parameters:
        channel - The channel to play the note on.
        pitch - The pitch to play.
        vel - The velocity of the note.
        tick - The tick to start the note at.
        dur - The duration of the note.

      • write

        public void write(java.io.File out,
                  int res)
        Writes the song to the specified file.
        Parameters:
        out - File to write the song to. File must end in .mid.
        res - The resolution of the MIDI file.

      • write

        public void write(java.io.File out)
        Writes the song to the specified file using Song.DEFAULT_MIDI_RESOLUTION as the resolution.
        Parameters:
        out - File to write the song to. File must end in .mid.

      • generateMinorOctave

        public static int[] generateMinorOctave(int start)
        Generates an array of 7 notes (an octave) in a minor key.
        Parameters:
        start - The starting note of the octave.
        Returns:
        An array of 7 notes in key.

      • generateMajorOctave

        public static int[] generateMajorOctave(int start)
        Generates an array of 7 notes (an octave) in a major key.
        Parameters:
        start - The starting note of the octave.
        Returns:
        An array of 7 notes in key.

      • generateChromaticOctave

        public static int[] generateChromaticOctave(int start)
        Generates an array of all 12 notes up to an octave above start.
        Parameters:
        start - The starting note of the octave.
        Returns:
        An array of 12 notes in key.

      • isAccidental

        public static boolean isAccidental(int pitch,
                                   int acc)
        Determines if a note is an accidental.
        Parameters:
        pitch - The pitch to check.
        acc - The amount of flats (negative number) or sharps (positive number) in the key signature.
        Returns:
        True if the note is an accidental, false if it is not.

      • transpose

        public static int transpose(int pitch,
                            int acc)
        Transposes the given note to C Major.
        Parameters:
        pitch - The pitch to transpose.
        acc - The amount of flats (negative number) or sharps (positive number) in the key signature.
        Returns:
        The transposed note.
